text: The voiced uvular implosive is an extremely rare type of consonantal sound. The symbol in the International Phonetic Alphabet that represents this sound is , a small capital letter G with a rightward pointing hook extending from the upper right of the letter. ==Features== Also ==Occurrence== {| class="wikitable" !colspan=2| Language !! Word !! IPA !! Meaning !! Notes |- |colspan=2| Mam || q'a || || 'fire' || |- |colspan=2| Ixil || q'ij || || 'sun' ||Website=http://www.native-languages.org/ixil_words.htm, "Ixil Word Set." Edited 2015. |} ==See also== * List of phonetics topics * Voiceless uvular implosive ==Notes== ==References== * Category:Uvular consonants Category:Implosives Category:Central consonants Category:Voiced oral consonants
title: Voiced uvular implosive
